instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..

threads.title: 3rd party ssd for macbook air/pro
threads.message:
Would the OWC ssd for macbook work actually in a macbook air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2014m like this:

[url]https://ie.eetgroup.com/i/OWCSSDA116G120-OWC-120GB-Aura-6G-Solid-State[/url]

its says 2011 so i guess not complatible, but is it worth to look for a compatible SSD? at the moment if the ssd dies we can just buy another second hand one, but would be better to buy new one, and its cheaper

threads.title: 3rd party ssd for macbook air/pro
threads.message: No not compatible it's Mini Sata vs PCIE way different connections. Up to you on buying a new or used one has to be the PCIE version from 2013-2015.

threads.title: 3rd party ssd for macbook air/pro
threads.message: 2013+ there are no properly working solutions (sleep issues), only original SSD will work.

threads.title: 3rd party ssd for macbook air/pro
threads.message:
and this one? it phisically looks like the original SSD connector

[url]https://www.owcdigital.com/products/aura-ssd[/url]


THE WAIT IS OVER
NEW POSSIBILITIES
For the first time, upgrade the PCIe-based flash SSD in your mid-2013 or later MacBook Pro with Retina display, MacBook Air, or Mac Pro with up to sixteen times the original capacity. The new Aura SSD continues OWC's dedication to giving you more from your Mac.

threads.title: 3rd party ssd for macbook air/pro
threads.message: Yeah indeed, but I think you will get sad when you learn of the prices.
